title: How to Make Caramel Chocolate Slice

steps.headline: Sift flour into a bowl.
steps.description: Add sugar and coconut, then stir until combined. Should look like a really loose biscuit batter.

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a pan (or microwave) and add to dry mix.
steps.description: Mix well until the mixture is slightly clumping when pressed together.

steps.headline: Press into a greased lamington tin, or a deep baking sheet (approximate size for quantity = 28cm x 18 cm).
steps.description: Ensure it is packed slightly to allow the base to stick together,

steps.headline: Bake in an oven preheated to approx 120 °C (248 °F) or moderate temperature.
Prepare the caramel while the base is cooking by placing all the ingredients into a saucepan.
steps.description: Stir to combine the mixture over a low heat until the caramel has thickened. The mix may stick to bottom of saucepan.

steps.headline: Bring the thickened mixture to boil, be slowly so as to prevent the mixture from burning.
steps.description: The caramel should turn a light golden to mid darker colour.

steps.headline: Remove the base from the oven and pour caramel over base.
steps.description: Ensure to cover the entire base.

steps.headline: Return the baking tray to over for a further 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and place in refrigerator when cooked.
steps.description: Make sure you do not sit the tin directly onto the fridge shelf. Use either a cooling top of a kitchen cloth to prevent the shelf from burning. Leave for a couple of hours or until cold.

steps.headline: Begin to prepare the chocolate topping when the base and caramel is cold.
steps.description: Place the chocolate and shortening into a saucepan over hot water. Stir the chocolate and shortening until smooth and runny (melted).

steps.headline: Spread the base with chocolate.

steps.headline: Place in refrigerator until chocolate is set.

text: Sift flour into a bowl. Add sugar and coconut, then stir until combined. Should look like a really loose biscuit batter. Melt the butter in a pan (or microwave) and add to dry mix. Mix well until the mixture is slightly clumping when pressed together. Press into a greased lamington tin, or a deep baking sheet (approximate size for quantity = 28cm x 18 cm). Ensure it is packed slightly to allow the base to stick together, Bake in an oven preheated to approx 120 °C (248 °F) or moderate temperature. Bake for 10 minutes. Prepare the caramel while the base is cooking by placing all the ingredients into a saucepan. Stir to combine the mixture over a low heat until the caramel has thickened. The mix may stick to bottom of saucepan. Bring the thickened mixture to boil, be slowly so as to prevent the mixture from burning. The caramel should turn a light golden to mid darker colour. Remove the base from the oven and pour caramel over base. Ensure to cover the entire base. Return the baking tray to over for a further 10 minutes.  Remove from heat and place in refrigerator when cooked. Make sure you do not sit the tin directly onto the fridge shelf. Use either a cooling top of a kitchen cloth to prevent the shelf from burning. Leave for a couple of hours or until cold. Begin to prepare the chocolate topping when the base and caramel is cold. Place the chocolate and shortening into a saucepan over hot water. Stir the chocolate and shortening until smooth and runny (melted). Spread the base with chocolate. Ensure the chocolate is evenly distributed. Place in refrigerator until chocolate is set.  Cut into slices and enjoy!
